title: Paper Wallet
synopsis: Bitcoin address keys may be printed on paper and used to store bitcoins offline. Compared with "hot wallets"—those that are connected to the Internet—these non-digital offline paper wallets are considered a "cold storage" mechanism better suited for safekeeping bitcoins. It is safe to use only if the prints the paper themselves. Bitcoins from a "cold storage" record obtained from a second party as a gift or payment should be immediately transferred to a safer account because the private key could have been copied.
